prompt: Explain to me how I can travel with my dog from London to Amsterdam and back
orig_response: To travel with your dog from London to Amsterdam and back, you can take the Eurostar train, which allows pets under certain conditions. First, ensure your dog is microchipped and has a valid pet passport, which includes proof of rabies vaccination at least 21 days prior to travel. Book a pet-friendly Eurostar ticket, as dogs must be kept in a carrier that fits under the seat. Arrive at the station early to allow time for check-in and security procedures. Upon arrival in Amsterdam, you can explore the city with your dog, as many parks and outdoor areas are pet-friendly. For the return journey, repeat the same steps, ensuring you have all necessary documentation and a suitable carrier for your dog. Always check the latest travel regulations and Eurostar policies before your trip, as they may change.
